content.description: This is the easiest option through the Rip Rap after climbing up The Wave. Clip one bolt at the crux (5.6), and then go up run-out climbing on easier terrain to the top. Be careful and watch for any possible loose holds or rock. Just before topping out gear options exist for anchors.
content.location:
On the far right side of the Rip Rap and above the route

Surfing in a Snowstorm

, locate one bolt on a steeper face.

content.description:
This is a continuation pitch pitch above the route

Inside Job

. From the anchor, climb up right of the grassy/bushy gully with gear placements to a bolt. Continue up on a right-trending series of bolts with a nice 0.5 cam midway to the top. Finish at a bolted anchor.
content.location:
This is the second pitch to

Inside Job

.

content.description: Climb up and directly into the crack or step right up to a pedastal and then step left back into the crack. At the top place gear high and then exit right at the top. Note: climb delicate at the top. When you move right, be cautious of possible wedged/stacked rocks in the crack ( not recommended for pro). Climb to a fixed anchor.
content.protection: A single rack of traditional gear.
content.location:
This is a possible third pitch to the route

Gettin' Barreled

. Or locate on the left side of the Rip Rap. This ascends a left-angling crack above a fixed anchor.

content.description: Climb up on gear to the fixed pin, and ascend somewhat awkward climbing through a steep bulge and a right-angling ramp. Better gear than it appears. Finish at a shared bolted anchor.
content.location:
Above the

Original Line

and in the middle of the Rip Rap...locate a fixed pin (Britt Ruegger).
